item.title: Report E-2025030186
item.description:
Report E-2025030186

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1426 ET, Jared Rahn with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 55 gallons of UN3066 corrosive unknown trade name released from poly drum due to shifting in transit and lack of dunnage. The release impacted concrete at the terminal yard and inside trailer # 3110507. Contractors report that the damaged drum was overpacked in a 95-gallon poly drum and the impacted absorbents/PPE were containerized in (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste will be left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025030673
item.description:
Report X-2025030673

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPOXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A CAKE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042-6034.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: REPORTED TO DOOR 90 ON PS3. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM. NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ABSORBENT. PLACED IN BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG REMOVED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2025030041
item.description:
Report I-2025030041

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: Tamaqua
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was beginning to offload product into customer's storage tank. When he started to pump the product, he quickly noticed a leak near the pump of the trailer. Driver immediately shut down the unloading process and isolated any leaks. He was able to empty the hose out into the tank and bleed off drum at customer, which relieved the pressure at the leak point to stop the leak. Leak lasted for only a few minutes until the pressure could be bled off into the customer's scrubber.

item.title: Report E-2025030255
item.description:
Report E-2025030255

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum along with the damaged product drum and product waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030248
item.description:
Report E-2025030248

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: TYRONE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: M. C. TANK TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 46000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: This is a customer unload. After arriving at the plant, the driver sits in his Tractor while the customer unloads the trailer. After the customer hooked up, they began to offload with a 3'' pump. Approximately 1 hour into the unloading cycle, the trailer suffered a vaccum collapse. It was determined that the customer failed to ensure that a ball valve was open on their vapor recovery line. Approximately 2000 gallons of HCL spilled from the bottom of the trailer During the event. All but 100-200 gallons was caught in their containment area. The remaining material left containment and leaked onto a gravel area leading to the unloading area. 1800 gallons inside containment was pumped into totes, and the material that left containment in a gravel area was neutralized and then disposed of by plant personnel. The trailer will be totaled by our insurance company.
